cc.tex module¶

class cc.tex.Tex(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Class for parsing tex, without regard to context. Can load a main tex file and all included files.

clean(string)¶

Clean up the text, i.e. remove comments, handle “~” characters.

Parameters

string (str) – The string to clean.

Returns

The string once cleaned.

comments (list of strs):

A list of any removed comments.

Return type

cleaned (str)

property cleaned¶

String with comments removed.

property comments¶

Comments found in the tex

interpret(string)¶

Interpret the LaTeX, i.e. process macros, and some commands and characters to make more compatible with the suite of cc language analysis tools.

property interpreted¶

String with comments removed.

cc.tex.interpret(command, subsequent_tex, commands={})¶

Interpret a LaTeX command. Uninterpretable commands are left in. In this context, to interpret a command means to modify the tex to be more compatible with the suite of cc language analysis tools.

Parameters

  • command (str) – Name of the command to interpret.

  • subsequent_tex (str) – All LaTex following the command call.

  • commands (dict of fns) – Functions dictating how to handle given commands. Built-in-functions consist of the module level functions in tex_commands.py

Returns

What to replace the call to command with.

dj (int):

How much of subsequent_tex is the argument for command I.e. subsequent_tex[:dj] is the input to the command.

commands (dict of functions):

Update dictionary of interpretable commands, outside of those in globals()

Return type

command_tex (str)

cc.tex.word_tokenize(sent, **kwargs)¶

Word tokenize that accounts for math-mode in LaTex, producing more comprehendible results. * All math mode inside one set of “$”s is grouped into one word. * All escaped “$”s outside mathmode are replaced with “$”s.

Parameters

  • sent (str) – Sentence to Tokenize

  • **kwargs – Passed to nltk.tokenize.word_tokenize

Returns

Word tokenized sentence.

Return type

words (list of strs)
